intro: Mitrastylus pilosus, commonly known as the silky mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant attaches to host trees, primarily eucalyptus, through its haustoria to extract water and nutrients. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Mitrastylus pilosus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various bird species.
